title: Why do white people dye their hair blond? Aren't brown hair and blue eyes just as beautiful? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, brown hair and blue eyes looks beautiful! I actually prefer it. Not that there’s anything wrong with blonde hair. The other 2 answers make seemingly valid points while ignoring the elephant in the room. The anglificafion Of fashion is something that has been around for centuries and exists all over the world. People in India purchase skin bleaching cream. Watch any Mexican novela(soap opera) and you’ll see that the most Anglo looking actors are always the lead, while the darker more indigenous actors are playing the maids. This is evident in Asian television as well and is backed up by the number of Asian women have surgery to file Down their bone structure or make their eyes appear wider and more Anglo. Black hair care is a multi million dollar industry, and apart from the natural hair movement, which has seen a recent resurgence, overwhelmingly, the majority of the products are intended to chemically straighten the hair, burn it into submission(see hotcomb) or Cover it all together by use of a wig or weave. White people are encouraged by the media to make themselves appear even whiter by the media. Need proof? Remember when Brittany Spears went brunette and had to hear all sorts of comments like “why would you go from a 10 to an 8?” Clearly our society’s standard of beauty strongly favor blond hair. For the record, I’m criticizing the concept that brittney was ridiculed for going brunette as if somehow that was a downgrade to her appearance. I don’t judge women for making choices about appearances, but I do judge the media for pushing unrealistic beauty standards and making us arbitrarily favor some traits over others. So yes, it is for fashion, and yes, it’s the same reason that people of color do it, but no, it’s not such a benign reason. edit: I’ve gathered from some of the responses that this answer is Perceived as offensive to some. I’m confused by this, because at no point do I insult anyone directly. I have never meant to imply that white people shouldn’t dye their hair blonde. I think it’s wrong that all around the world, society is telling women what is beautiful and I’ve noticed certain patterns come up in that, but as a person who’s been dying their hair pink and blue for the last decade and a half, I’d never critique someone for wanting to dye their hair.
